CatDescriptText: Mr. Leonard Springs, 2432 Fifth Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "Sometimes we do. However, it is just among a few Negroes and not among the majority.  Many of the persons who do display prejudices are people who after getting into business, think that they are better than anybody else."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Leonard Springs standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with pedestrians and Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
